bug.author: Tpt
bug.summary: No meaningful message when a language is not supported by doc.noun_chunks
bug.description:
When the vocabulary language is not set to "en" or "de" the doc.noun_chunks method fails with the following error: <denchmark-code>File "XX.py", line 55, in YY for np in doc.noun_chunks: File "spacy/tokens/doc.pyx", line 404, in __get__ (spacy/tokens/doc.cpp:9194) TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not callable </denchmark-code>
It is because there is no CHUNKERS defined for the language in spcay.syntax.iterators. A meaningful error message should maybe be added and a nice way to plug-in others LANG_noun_chunks functions. <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: Ubuntu 16.04 Python Version Used: 3.5 spaCy Version Used: 1.3 Environment Information:

comments.comment: Agreed, thanks. Support for other languages is still patchy and unofficial, so you'll probably meet a lot of similar rough spots.

This should now be fixed both on master and in v2. Also improved the error messages – they now link to the documentation instead of telling the user to download a specific model (which was non-existent for languages other than , and – see <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/1051>#1051</denchmark-link> ).
